Hello all!

I've been using the wpftoolkit for a "shootout" we are doing within our team. The datepicker control does not display a time portion of the datetime, will this be included in the future?

Also, since the time portion is not handled, it seems that when you tab through the field, the property it is bound to  now gets the datetime with the correct date but the time portion set back to "12:00:00am". This is a bit of a pain.. have others seen this?

Thanks
Harold

Hi cycleguy -

Adding the time to the DatePicker is not one of our planned items. As for your Binding issue, can you provide a re-pro?

-Eric, MSFT

There have been 2 different answers to this  :) Here in this thread it was stated it was going to be added: http://wpf.codeplex.com/Thread/View.aspx?ThreadId=46813
Harold

Sorry for the confusion - I was referring to long term plans and Eric was speaking of the shorter term.  We don't have this work on the schedule for the next few months, but we would like to add this feature in a future (as of yet unplanned) release.
